nodes.text: under the UN Refugee Convention to which it is a party China is obligated not to push back asylum seekers in danger of persecution
At any moment North Koreans risk being picked up by Chinese authorities and returned to North Korea under the terms of a secret 1986 agreement between Beijing and Pyongyang
China's behaviour is not respecting the convention
China is obligated not to push back North Koreans
North Koreans refugees are asylum seekers in danger of prosecution
In North Korea anyone leaving the country without authorization is subject to three years in a labor camp or even the death penalty.
If somebody is subject to death or prison he is in danger of prosecution
